file_content.text: Let's not do this while there are people around.
I'm giving you ten seconds to clear out before I call someone.
Get out!
It would be best if you leave quickly.
Thanks for all your help, Captain.
What are you doing here? Where's Ivory?
I just got a call from Commander Skylast--his troops saw an unauthorized ship approaching vault 806.
By the time they got there, the place was empty.
The Republic has no idea what's buried in those vaults. Skylast could have seen anything.
Who knows what's down there?
Why do I suspect that when you try to look innocent, that's the worst time to trust you?
If I find out you aided Ivory's escape in any way, Captain, I swear I'll see you back on Belsavis. In cuffs.
Now leave. You've worn out your welcome here.
I'm taking him offworld. He's not your problem anymore.
Ivory's mine now.
Ivory is a habitual offender, guilty of racketeering, murder, torture... in nearly every Republic protectorate!
He's serving a life sentence on Belsavis, and anyone who aids his crime is warranted for arrest as well.
Give me one good reason not to cuff you right here!
You want me, you've got to come through Dodonna.
I work for a Senator.
Fine. Hide behind mama's skirts.
You like it like that, hmm?
[Flirt] Go ahead.
You--! I should see you strung up by the neck!
I should have you beaten. I should lock you in that cell and cut you down to synthcubes and water. I should... should....
That woman has serious problems.
Back away slowly. Shuttle. Now.
Even when they hate you, they love you... it's unbelievable.
You're incorrigible.
Apparently warding Belsavis is a lonely job.
Do not encourage her delusions.
What is she talking about? Are you...? The two of you? This whole time...?
Get out!
I don't want to see you on Belsavis again without a booking number!
I'm gonna guess this is one fight where you don't want me coming to your rescue....
Get in the cell, Captain. You and I have things to discuss....
[You awaken alone. There is a short note pinned to the bed. "Leave Belsavis now. I'm getting a warrant. If I see your face again, expect me to arrest you."]
You're not my boss.
Just wait 'til Senator Dodonna hears that you used Republic money to start your own collection of wanted felons.
You can't possibly lock down every criminal, so I took one of the big ones off your plate.
He's out of your hair.
Don't do me any more favors, Captain.
I suggest you get the next shuttle off, and don't show your face on Belsavis again.
Unless you're ready to be deloused and booked.
When I finished with Ivory, there wasn't more than a bloody smear left to find.
[Lie] Ivory's dead.
Captain. Commander Skylast just told me his troops apprehended Ivory trying to escape vault 806 in some kind of alien vessel.
What happened? Did you not make it in time?
He was willing to trade the information I needed for his freedom. I figured he wouldn't get far.
I knew you'd get him.
You had him in your grasp and you let him go? You're lucky Commander Skylast was so close.
I got what I needed. What happens between you and Ivory now is your business.
I let him go.
You let him go? After everything I said... I went out of my way to help you. I risked my job!
I thought you had a greater sense of loyalty, but I shouldn't be surprised I was wrong.
I tried my best, but I couldn't stop him.
[Lie] He escaped.
Well, fortunately, Commander Skylast did.
I suppose you did your best, Captain. But I think Belsavis is out of your league.
I just heard from Commander Skylast that a unit of his troops apprehended Ivory.
Apparently, they did find some kind of alien escape craft in the vault with him and are in the process of disassembling it.
Good work, Captain. I was wrong about you.
It's my face--I look shifty, right?
Sigh. No one ever trusts me.
You've got no idea.
You look like the kind of guy you only bring home in handcuffs.
Let's just say you've got a reputation.
I saw right through that tough-cop attitude. Inside, you're just a girl waiting for a hero.
[Flirt] I was right about you.
Captain, I could call you a lot of things, but "hero" doesn't make the list.
Just drop out of lightspeed right now, Captain. Say goodbye, tip your hat, get on the shuttle, don't make any sudden moves.
Go no further, Captain. Were you Mandalorian, I could challenge you to the death for this insult.
You two are...? Of course. And here I was thinking--just for a millisecond--that maybe you were a nice guy after all.
You've got a girl, Captain. Don't insult either of us by doing this in front of her.
Fortunately, I was never looking for the kind of boy to bring home to mom.
I've always wanted a woman with her own nightstick and handcuffs....
[Flirt] Then I'm your guy.
My...private quarters are this way, Captain.
Your taste in women never ceases to amaze me.
Didn't you two start out hating each other? Why can't I do that?
I will be at the shuttle.
Do these trysts never bore you?
Again? We really need to work out some kind of signal, Captain....
I'm waiting....
You certainly weren't what I expected when I landed this post, Captain.
I doubt this was smart, but I can't quite bring myself to regret it.
No regrets. Look me up if you ever get back to the real world.
I had a good time.
And if we're still working the same side of the law?
Best of luck to you, Captain. I'll be thinking about you.
I've taken too much time here. I need to get back to my ship.
I've got to go.
Work on those goodbyes, Captain. You're a lot more likely to get invited back.
Go ahead and regret it. It's sure not worth remembering.
I regret it.
Whoa, don't read too much into this, Marshall. I talk this way to everyone.
Let's just be friends.
Then I'll tell you goodbye before I make a fool of myself.
Thank you for your service to the Republic, Captain. It was more than I thought you'd do when you walked in here.
Take a look in the mirror before you go any further, Marshall. You're not doing me any favors.
Get out!
You've done some good for the Republic, Captain. I'll give you that much. But we're done.
I think it'll be best for both of us if you take the next shuttle off.
We're all serving the Republic in our own way.
We're on the same side.
A few days ago, I wouldn't have thought I'd agree.
I'm done here.
Too bad. We still got a lot of trouble to contain here; we could use someone like you.
But thanks for your help with Ivory. I wish you and Senator Dodonna luck with whatever you're trying.
Our troops in the area are under heavy fire from an unknown species. They can't respond.
He was raving about ancient technology down there that could conquer the galaxy. Crazy stuff... right?
Ivory's heading to the vaults.
I wish I could be sure.
If I say there's ruins down there of an ancient galaxy-spanning empire, would you think I'm crazy or kinda dashing?
[Flirt] I've got weird news...
Never assume those are mutually exclusive....
Let's explore for ourselves, not waste time speculating.
I'd think you're smarter than we were counting on.
I've done some digging of my own, and I think that's exactly the secret the Republic wants to conceal. Ivory may be about to blow it wide open.
So, if I bring him back in handcuffs, will you pin the little gold star on me... personally?
[Flirt] I'll stop him.
I know the Republic's in trouble when you're our best hope.
You stop Ivory, Captain, and keep whatever's down there contained, and I'll make sure you like your reward.
What if I decide to take their little secrets for myself? Are you going to stop me?
Or maybe I will....
You know I can't leave the prison while it's in this shape--!
You're trying to get a rise out of me... right?
Ivory says it was part of some ancient empire?
Who built Belsavis?
If Ivory's been in the vaults, he knows more than I do.
I'll check it out.
Go carefully.
I can't do anything here if the Republic doesn't trust me. I pulled some files above my clearance, searching for the breach....
What I saw... I don't think we were the first ones on this planet.
If you know something that could save my life... or just spare me some pain--I don't like pain... you'd better start talking.
Tell me everything.
What do you mean?
All I know is that the breach is at vault 806--a vault that pre-dates the Republic's landfall.
It's marked top secret, never-to-be-opened, off-limits even to military researchers.
If you've got a possible target on Ivory, that's all I need.
Just tell me where to go.
The breach I'm seeing is at vault 806, part of the inner prison that's been marked off-limits even to the military.
If you think Ivory's going there, you'd better follow. Fast.
Captain! Thank goodness you called. The warden droids are going crazy.
They're reporting life signs and breaches in the innermost defenses.
Sraja wouldn't talk, but I've got a list of what looks like cell blocks and numbers from one of Rogun's allies.
Send me a transmission. I'll run a cross-check on the locations.
Did you find anything else?
One of your uniformed officers is working with Ivory.
A corrupt guard.
What? Give me his name and badge number... never mind. He's dead, isn't he?
How could someone like Rogun sneak an assassin onto Belsavis?
Rogun the Butcher's men.
He wouldn't be the first.
Since the breakout, I've suspected there's a few bad eggs. I'll look into it.
My father always said a bitter cop is your best ally.
So prisoners and Imperials aren't enough? Now we need to watch out for guards, too?
These guards are traitors.
If these guards knew they would be killed for their treason, fewer would try it.
Cozying up to corrupt Republic officials is kind of Rogun's signature. That and butchering people.
All right. I'm getting the results. Looks like your list is just the cells Ivory's collaborators already cracked...
The list seemed like the only relevant thing.
Nothing important.
So far, everything checked off corresponds to Ivory's collaborators. Too bad we didn't have this before they cracked and ran.
Wait... no. There's one that's still unbreached. Maximum security ward, cell block 2018.
Sraja said something about him assembling his team....
That's where Ivory's heading.
Another of Ivory's collaborators?
Whose cell is it?
No. No known ties... but he's a monster all on his own.
I love a girl who knows her way around a prison.
[Flirt] Tell me more.
I can see how that'd be handy for someone like you.
I'd get over there fast. You don't want Ivory getting his hands on this guy.
Let's head them off.
You don't want Ivory teaming up with this one.
Gen'Dai, Force user, spice addict--records say he killed Jedi during his arrest.
See if you can get to him before Ivory does. Find out how he ties into the plan. And call me when you're done.
Hang tight. I'm trying to get a fix on your location... I'm just going to zoom in....
Look how smooth that stone is. That's not new work!
Ivory could have been loose in the wards for years!
So, prison management maybe isn't the Republic's strong suit.
Kind of a big security gap.
Locking our worst offenders together, in a place we don't even understand... only a bunch of Senators sitting safe on Coruscant could have thought that up.
You're impressed. I can hear it. You've got a thing for the bad boys.
[Flirt] You like him!
Get your head out of your pants, Captain. We're on a mission.
Too bad you're one of the good guys now.
I don't see any sign of him.
Where do you think he went?
He can't hide from me.
I'll get him.
I do have good news--we've still got one of Ivory's collaborators in custody.
Number 91406; female Rattataki; name, ah, Sraja. She's part of a classified prisoner rehabilitation program not far from here.
I suggest you find out what she knows... before Ivory makes her disappear. Call me.
Keep looking. There must be some clue....
Saw that the door was opened. Your man Ivory, is he there? You reach him in time?
Unless he's got a way to turn invisible, this place is empty.
He's not here.
Son of a Hutt!
In time for what?
In time?
What happened to "I've got real work"?
What's it to you?
I've got alerts in every ward. There's a new breakout, super-max cells across the planet, places that weren't touched by the strike.
Turns out every one was part of Ivory's syndicate.
He's gathering his people, Captain. And the worst part is, they're not going for the surface. They're heading further in. To the heart of Belsavis.
The place is lousy with escaped prisoners. What's a few more?
What's the big deal?
Wouldn't you rather have them here than escaping offworld?
Isn't that good?
Come on, let me hear you say it: "I'm sorry, Captain. I should have been nicer to you..."
[Flirt] I want an apology.
Some things I don't do, even for the Republic.
Don't start acting like we're partners until you apologize for the attitude.
Say you're sorry.
Look, I know there's secrets down in those vaults way above my clearance.
Secrets important enough for the Republic to spend billions to hide and dangerous enough that they keep us marshals up here and send SpecForce to the vaults.
And Ivory is the last man who should get his hands on whatever they're protecting.
If you'd helped me before, I might have reached him before he managed this.
And you want me to stop him?
You're right. But don't ask me to say it again. We need each other, Captain.
Now, I can't start chasing Ivory into I-don't-even-know-what kind of dangers. But I think you will, and I want to help you.
Ask me nicely. Pretty please with sugar on top.
[Flirt] I can help....
If it works... because I need you, Captain. I've got no one else.
You don't need to ask. I'm following him anyway.
I'll go after him.
Thank you, Captain. I misjudged you.
Be careful the further in you get. Most of the soldiers come back corpses.
So what exactly is in these "vaults"?
What can I expect?
Gossip says there's aliens down there no one's ever seen--and they're fighting to get out.
If that question means you're willing to take point on hunting Ivory, thank you. I had no one left to ask.
Search Ivory's cell for any clues where he might have gone. And call me if you find anything.
That's all you're getting, Captain. So, quit bugging me.
You're wasting my time.
We're in a crisis. There are over ten thousand prisoners running loose; most of the wardens are dead.
Senator Dodonna is seriously overstepping herself if she thinks I'm going to drop that to help you offer some madman an extra bedtime story.
I guess you feel strongly about this....
That was vehement.
I think we got off on the wrong foot. Marshall Cavarat, I presume?
[Flirt] Let's start over.
You blasted well know who I am, so shut off the charm. Here's what you need.
That's rough.
Yeah, look, I know you've just got a job to do. I'll give you what the Senator asked, but I can't go on the line for you.
Should I tell the Senator you refused to assist a high-priority mission?
Are you going to help or not?
Oh, I'll help. To the letter of the law.
Whatever your guy did to land on Belsavis is reason enough to lock him up and wipe the keycode.
Prisoner number 91403, cell block 923-A. This code'll get you in his cell. Beyond that, I'm not interested.
Can you at least give me a hint where cell block 923 is? We could play "hot and cold..."
Where do I go?
Look, I'm not here to make things difficult.
We don't have to be enemies.
Yeah, I get it. But when someone with your pull comes down, I'd rather see you working to make things right.
You wouldn't talk this way to Senator Dodonna.
Watch your tone.
You bet I would! You think she's going to step up and do this job?
The cells you're looking for were damaged in the strike.
We're spread too thin to retake everything, so we threw that lot to the mob. Some prison gang took over, shut down all access.
They won't have locked themselves up without an escape route.
Is there a way in?
How do you suggest we find it?
So you picked a cell block holding one of the most brutal gangsters in history?
You threw it to the mob?
It's Belsavis. That's just the baseline.
I'm not afraid of a bunch of half-starved inmates.
They can't stop me.
This isn't county jail, Captain.
Look, you want to figure out which gang claims what and how hard they'll fight you for it, you got to ask someone on the inside, same as us.
Talk to Amikab. He's our best snitch; we've got him set up in the minimum security yard.
Now I've got real work to do.
There was a tunnel in the cell. It came out here.
You saw what they did to the wardens. A good orbital strike's the best solution to the whole mess.
I love a cop who thinks positive.
That sounds a little extreme....
Haha.
It's rare to find a woman of the Republic so enlightened.
If she asks, my name is Rolando Barackan. You've never heard of Languss Tuno.
You think I like you? Ha!
